Posts.Content: sue3645 wrote: Hi all -- hoping to tap into your knowledge.  I usually hang out on the Mets board, but I have a rad specific question for you.... I was diagnosed with inflammatory breast cancer with liver mets last year (ER+, PR+, HER2-).  Taxol + Avastin cleared up the liver mets and resolved the majority of the breast too.  I had a bilateral mastectomy four weeks ago. I will start rads in about two weeks. My radiation onc would like me to have rads every day for six weeks. She'd also like me to have hyperthermia twice a week. Hyperthermia is where they heat up the rads area to make the rads more effective. They'll heat it up to about 108 degrees, which the doc says may cause "some discomfort" (ya think???). The theory is that the heat will make the rads more effective -- been shown to work in some cases. It's used mostly in cases of bc recurrence (as well as prostate and rectal cancer), but they think it may be of benefit in the metastatic setting. The rad onc said they don't do it everywhere -- Duke is using it the most, not sure if other places are trying it. Has anyone heard of this?   Done it?  Have research on it?   Thanks so much !! Sue dx IBC 10/30/07, liver mets 11/13/07. Taxol+Avastin for nine months. Bilateral Mastectomy in August 2008. Radiation from Sept - Nov 2008. NED since then! Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2009 09:15AM sue3645 wrote: Virginiamom -- sorry you have to join us, although you are welcomed with open arms!  I was Stage IV on diagnosis as well, and it's truly a kick in the gut, isn't it?  I remember the day before I got results of all the tests, I said to my dh "I haven't even prepared myself for the thought that it may have already spread".    Best of luck to you and I agree with everyone else to be sure you are dealing with mets by getting a biopsy.  I had liver mets and did not have them biopsied, but that was because they were NOT seen on a CT scan that I had 2 yrs before for something completely unrelated.  They responded VERY well to chemo and were GONE in nine months.  Let us know how we can help!

Posts.Content: May 19, 2008 10:12AM sue3645 wrote: I have been on that same combo since November.   I get it on Mondays, and the pattern for me has been pretty consistent -- Monday is okay, Tuesday night is horrible (really tired, very sensitive to sounds, headaches), Wednesday is bad, by Thursday I start to feel a bit better and by Friday I'm fine.   I'm working full time though, so I think I'd feel much better if I didn't expend so much energy at work each day.  I shaved my head after the second treatment as soon as it started to fall out.  After the initial shock from the Taxol, my hair started growing back in and now it's about 1.5 inches long.  My onc said that is normal with Taxol.  Hope you are still feeling okay!
